title: Update FromJSON instances to enforce invariants at parse time
description:

instance FromJSON ClientInfo where
  parseJSON = withObject "ClientInfo" $ \o -> do
    name <- o .: "client_name"
    uriList <- o .: "redirect_uris"
    case nonEmpty uriList of
      Nothing -> fail "redirect_uris must contain at least one URI"
      Just uris -> ClientInfo name uris <$> ...

- authRedirectUri: valid URI
- authCodeChallenge: non-empty
- authCodeChallengeMethod: valid ADT value
- authScopes: Set of valid scopes

- HTTPServerConfig has httpTracer field
- runServerHTTP also takes tracer parameter

- Example uses nullIOTracer in config with misleading comment

1. Remove httpTracer field from HTTPServerConfig
2. Keep tracer parameter in runServerHTTP (already correct pattern)
3. Update all code that sets httpTracer in config

title: OAuth Consent Screen - User-selectable permission grants
description:
## Context

After user authentication (login), OAuth flows may require a **consent screen** where users can:
- View permissions the application is requesting
- **Narrow** permissions (grant fewer than requested)
- Select specific resources (e.g., GitHub's "Select repositories" UI)

## Current State

The 004-oauth-auth-typeclasses feature does NOT include consent UI, but is designed to support it:

- `PendingAuthorization.pendingScope` stores requested scopes
- `AuthorizationCode.authScopes` stores granted scopes (can be âŠ† requested)
- Flow has natural insertion point between login and code issuance
- Typeclasses don't encode approval policy - handler logic decides

## Where Consent Fits in OAuth Flow

```
DCR (/register) â†’ Authorization Request (/authorize) â†’ Login (/login)
    â†’ [CONSENT SCREEN] â†’ Authorization Code â†’ Token Exchange (/token)
```

## Research Needed

1. **Scope presentation UI** - How to display permissions meaningfully to users
2. **Scope narrowing** - UX patterns for users to reduce granted permissions  
3. **Resource-bound permissions** - Model for "repo:read on repos X,Y,Z" vs "repo:read on all"
4. **Consent persistence** - Remember user consent decisions (optional `ConsentStore`?)
5. **Incremental consent** - Request additional scopes later (Google's pattern)

## Implementation Sketch

- New state: `PendingConsent` or extend `PendingAuthorization` with status
- New endpoints: `GET /consent` (show UI), `POST /consent` (submit decision)
- Handler: compare requested vs selected scopes, store narrowed set
- Optional: `ConsentStore` typeclass for persistent consent memory

## References

- GitHub OAuth App authorization: https://docs.github.com/en/apps/oauth-apps/building-oauth-apps/authorizing-oauth-apps
- Google incremental auth: https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/web-server#incrementalAuth
- RFC 6749 Section 3.3 (scope): https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.3
